The given code chunk is part of the `handleAvatarControls` method in `DevWalker.py`, which manages avatar movement based on user input. The specific section handles input state evaluation to determine movement (forward/backward), levitation, sliding, and rotation speeds, including checks for Auto-Run functionality and debug indicator display.

Context: Avatar movement controls logic handling input states, speed calculations, and debug information display within the `handleAvatarControls` method of `DevWalker.py`.

# Check for Auto-Run
        if base.localAvatar.getAutoRun():
            forward = 1
            reverse = 0

        # Determine what the speeds are based on the buttons:
        self.speed=(
                (forward and self.avatarControlForwardSpeed or
                reverse and -self.avatarControlReverseSpeed))
        self.liftSpeed=(
                (levitateUp and self.avatarControlForwardSpeed or
                levitateDown and -self.avatarControlReverseSpeed))
        self.slideSpeed=(
                (slideLeft and -self.avatarControlForwardSpeed) or
                (slideRight and self.avatarControlForwardSpeed))
        self.rotationSpeed=(
                (turnLeft and self.avatarControlRotateSpeed) or
                (turnRight and -self.avatarControlRotateSpeed))

        if self.wantDebugIndicator:
            self.displayDebugInfo()
